alert.note: Alert for Monroe; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 13 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Warren, east central Monroe and northeastern Northampton Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 700 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Belvidere, or 14 miles northeast of Easton, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Washington, Blairstown, Belvidere, Oxford, Hope, East Bangor, Great Meadows-Vienna, Brass Castle, Allamuchy-Panther Valley, Pleasant Valley, Delaware Water Gap, Columbia, Portland and Shawnee. This includes Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
